title: Why Kindles and e-readers have been victims of their own success
text:
Peeling open the first pages of a great novel has been one of life's great pleasures for millions of readers. But in recent years, the future of the book has been under threat.

So-called e-readers, such as Amazon's Kindle, threatened the future of the traditional paper book. The first Kindle was released in 2007 and the devices, which used non-backlit screens and digital e-ink to mimic a reading experience on paper, exploded in popularity, selling in their tens of millions.

But now it appears that e-reader sales may be reaching their epilogue. While the humble book's death was mourned too early, now e-reader popularity is slipping away.
